result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell Lamont Turner Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mitchell Lamont Turner Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mitchell Lamont Turner Jr was found guilty of Attempt Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft if Taken/Person/Corpse, Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution to be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Restitution set at zero.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

CONDTIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION, IF REVOKED:
- Supervision by the Mental Health Unit.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any program deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/education/vocation if deemed appropriate by a physician.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell Lamont Turner Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Certification of SENTENCING transcript commencing 06-26-2015 received and filed. (23 Pages.) CH

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS with 129 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is  YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.  

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- Supervision by the mental health unit.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation if deemed appropriate by a physician.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.


Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Pursuant to negotiations, Count 1 is DISMISSED.  As to Count 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Mitchell Lamont Turner in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Mitchell Lamont Turner in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to add Count 2- Attempt Theft from Person or Corpse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 943.20(1)(a) and 943.20(3)(e), 939.50(3)(g) and 939.32, a Class G Felony.

Defendant Mitchell Lamont Turner in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Mitchell Lamont Turner not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mitchell Lamont Turner in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Mitchell Lamont Turner in custody.  Ron Dague for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any Family Dollar Store in Milwaukee County or Artavia L. or her residence.

Defendant Mitchell Lamont Turner in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Mitchell Lamont Turner in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
